column4: I have^H^Hd a problem with the shell (bash). :( I want to traverse a file in a for loop and execute it for every line. But "for LINE in $(cat $FILE);do foo;done" treats every `word' separated by any whitespace as one iteration - and I've found my answer! The variable $IFS holds the field separator. :)
cat file | while read line; do echo "$line"; done
or even better.  while read line; do echo "$line"; done < file
